Title.evidence: In this randomized, triple-masked, placebo-controlled study

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomized, triple-masked, placebo-controlled study

Participants.evidence: subjects received a stimulating interscalene catheter using an ultrasound-guided, in-plane posterior approach

Intervention.evidence: continuous posterior interscalene block provides superior postoperative analgesia compared to a single-injection ropivacaine interscalene block

Objective.evidence: we tested the hypothesis that an ultrasound-guided continuous posterior interscalene block provides superior postoperative analgesia

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was average pain on postoperative day (POD) 1 (scale: 0–10)

Number_Analysed.evidence: 30 perineural catheters were placed per protocol
